intro: Crepis trichocephala, commonly known as the hairy-headed mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides, often forming dense mats. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk. It is an annual or biennial species that produces small, wind-dispersed seeds.
